definition: to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: He's 5 foot 4 inches tall, has no hair and he wears a perpetual frown on his face.
sentences.chinese: 头发都没了，一脸的苦相，愁眉不展。

sentences.english: Moreover, I am sad. What do you wish me to say to you?
sentences.chinese: 况且我正在愁眉不展，你们要我谈些什么呢？

sentences.english: Never frown, because you never know who is falling in love with your smile.
sentences.chinese: 别愁眉不展，因为你不知道谁会爱上你的笑容。

sentences.english: Little wonder the prime minister looks anxious.
sentences.chinese: 这也就无怪乎总理大人看上去愁眉不展了。

sentences.english: While foreign unions cheer, multinational companies fret.
sentences.chinese: 尽管外国工会欢呼雀跃，但是跨国公司却愁眉不展。

sentences.english: Ladies, are you feeling bad about those extra five pounds?
sentences.chinese: 姑娘们，你还在为身上多出的五磅肉而愁眉不展吗？

sentences.english: That, when December blights thy brow.
sentences.chinese: 当十二月的严寒令人愁眉不展。

definition: sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
